chargeHist.descr: Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction(939.62(1)(b) Repeater)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer Pearson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.39.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes:
*****8-15-14 Judge Grady, Court ordered that the probation term of this case shall run concurrently with the total sentence imposed in 13CF2771 *****
Concurrent with: with the total sentence imposed in 13CF2771

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Batterers Intervention program.  Absolute sobriety, random urine screens. Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
No contact with victim, unless approved by agent or court.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.

Provide DNA sample. Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges during probation period, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.

No contact with firearms. Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.

timeConds.notes: Stayed pending review which agent is to set 90 days after release.

charges.descr: Intentionally Contact - Order for Felony Conviction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jennifer Pearson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Signed, Filed & Distributed, Order Amended Judgment of Conviction.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Lindsey Grady, Br. 23, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify probation term.

Defendant Jennifer Pearson in court with attorney Russell J. A. Jones.  Defendant Jennifer Pearson in custody.  Evan Glaberson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Additional statements by the victim. 
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to a term in the House of Correction of 12 MONTHS, consecutive, straight time. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS consecutive to current term of initial confinement, but consecutive to extended supervision.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim, unless approved by agent or court. 
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharges during probation period, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
-Court WAIVED all NON-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-Agent to set review date 90 DAYS after release.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Attorney Russell J Jones in court, defendant Jennifer Pearson not in court, in custody.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced from WSP. Case set for Sentencing. Discussion as to defendant's pro se motion. Court advised parties any motions must be filed 10 DAYS in advance of the next date. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department pending Sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER. Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Sentencing.

Defendant Jennifer Pearson in court with attorney Russell J Jones.  Defendant Jennifer Pearson in custody.  Matthew G Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state, the court ordered Count 1 AMENDED to REMOVE the Repeater enhancer (939.62(1)(b)).  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jennifer Pearson in court with attorney Russell J.A. Jones.  Defendant Jennifer Pearson in custody.  Matthew G. Puthukulam appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Michael B

Defendant Jennifer Pearson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Jennifer Pearson in custody.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
